channel.title: üè¢ Stanford University on NeurIPS 2024
channel.description: Recent content in üè¢ Stanford University on NeurIPS 2024

item.title: Accelerating Diffusion Models with Parallel Sampling: Inference at Sub-Linear Time Complexity
item.description: Researchers achieve sub-linear time complexity for diffusion model inference using parallel sampling with poly-logarithmic time complexity.

item.title: Automatic Outlier Rectification via Optimal Transport
item.description: This study presents a novel single-step outlier rectification method using optimal transport with a concave cost function, surpassing the limitations of conventional two-stage approaches by jointly op…

item.title: Constrained Diffusion with Trust Sampling
item.description: Trust Sampling enhances guided diffusion by iteratively optimizing constrained generation at each step, improving efficiency and accuracy in image and 3D motion generation.

item.title: Convolutional Differentiable Logic Gate Networks
item.description: Convolutional Differentiable Logic Gate Networks achieve state-of-the-art accuracy on CIFAR-10 with 29x fewer gates than existing models, demonstrating highly efficient deep learning inference.

item.title: Deep Learning for Computing Convergence Rates of Markov Chains
item.description: Deep learning tackles Markov chain convergence rate analysis! Deep Contractive Drift Calculator (DCDC) provides sample-based bounds in Wasserstein distance, surpassing traditional methods’ limitations…

item.title: FactorSim: Generative Simulation via Factorized Representation
item.description: FACTORSim generates full, coded simulations from natural language descriptions, outperforming existing methods in accuracy and zero-shot transfer learning by using a factored POMDP representation.

item.title: Generalized Linear Bandits with Limited Adaptivity
item.description: This paper introduces two novel algorithms, achieving optimal regret in generalized linear contextual bandits despite limited policy updates, a significant advancement for real-world applications.

item.title: Get rich quick: exact solutions reveal how unbalanced initializations promote rapid feature learning
item.description: Unbalanced initializations dramatically accelerate neural network feature learning by modifying the geometry of learning trajectories, enabling faster feature extraction and improved generalization.

item.title: Graph-based Uncertainty Metrics for Long-form Language Model Generations
item.description: Graph Uncertainty boosts LLM factuality by 6.8% using graph centrality to estimate claim-level uncertainty and a novel uncertainty-aware decoding process.

item.title: Learning Formal Mathematics From Intrinsic Motivation
item.description: AI agent MINIMO learns to generate challenging mathematical conjectures and prove them, bootstrapping from axioms alone and self-improving in both conjecture generation and theorem proving.

item.title: Learning Linear Causal Representations from General Environments: Identifiability and Intrinsic Ambiguity
item.description: LiNGCREL, a novel algorithm, provably recovers linear causal representations from diverse environments, achieving identifiability despite intrinsic ambiguities, thus advancing causal AI.

item.title: Newton Losses: Using Curvature Information for Learning with Differentiable Algorithms
item.description: Newton Losses enhance training of neural networks with complex objectives by using second-order information from loss functions, achieving significant performance gains.

item.title: Optimistic Verifiable Training by Controlling Hardware Nondeterminism
item.description: Researchers developed a verifiable training method that uses high-precision training with adaptive rounding and logging to achieve exact training replication across different GPUs, enabling efficient …

item.title: Optimization Algorithm Design via Electric Circuits
item.description: Design provably convergent optimization algorithms swiftly using electric circuit analogies; a novel methodology automating discretization for diverse algorithms.

item.title: ReFT: Representation Finetuning for Language Models
item.description: ReFT: Revolutionizing language model finetuning by directly manipulating hidden representations, achieving superior efficiency and performance compared to existing methods.

item.title: Scaling Laws for Reward Model Overoptimization in Direct Alignment Algorithms
item.description: Direct Alignment Algorithms (DAAs) for LLM alignment suffer from over-optimization, even without explicit reward models; this paper empirically demonstrates this and proposes scaling laws to understan…

item.title: Scaling Laws with Vocabulary: Larger Models Deserve Larger Vocabularies
item.description: Boosting LLM performance: This research shows how larger language models need bigger vocabularies for optimal efficiency and performance.

item.title: TFG: Unified Training-Free Guidance for Diffusion Models
item.description: TFG: A unified, training-free framework for boosting diffusion model performance by efficiently searching its algorithm-agnostic design space.
